titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter in February 2011

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:11-0400

did.abstract: Seneca dance songs recorded at Coldspring, New York. Also includes a story, personal narratives, and interview discussions about sickness, medicine, witchcraft, and related Seneca ceremonies and customs.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Accessioned with and removed from the George S. Snyderman Papers (Ms.Coll.51).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Duplicate of original recording on reel 2 from same collection.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
